flawed_nl_solution:
Her children ate 25% of the 16 brownies so they ate 0.25*16 = <<25*0.01*16=4>>4 slices
There were 16 brownies and the children ate 4 slices, leaving 16-4 = <<16-4=12>>12 brownies
The family ate 50% of the remaining 12 brownies so they ate 0.5*12 = <<50*0.01*12=6>>6 brownies
There were 12 brownies and they ate 6 which leaves 12-6 = <<12-6=10>>10 brownies
Lorraine had 1 more of the 10 remaining brownies which leaves 10-1 = <<10-1=9>>9 brownies
#### 9

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6, not 10. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
